summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) forwarding a Bloomberg News article about the detention of French modeling agent Jean-Luc Brunel in France. The SDNY declines to comment on the story, which details Brunel's arrest as part of the French investigation into his alleged role in supplying underage girls to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Christian Berthelsen
persons.context: Bloomberg reporter who emailed the SDNY asking if an extradition request for Jean-Luc Brunel would be unsealed.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: French modeling agent detained in France for questioning regarding his alleged role in luring underage girls for Jeffrey Epstein. Faces charges of rape, sexual assault on minors, and human trafficking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The late financier at the center of the case. The article states he faced sex-trafficking charges and died by suicide in jail in August 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Former Girlfriend and Confidante of Epstein, Defendant
persons.context: In custody in New York awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges, suspected of helping Epstein lure underage girls.

persons.name: Gaspard Sebag
persons.context: Author of the Bloomberg News article about Jean-Luc Brunel's detention.

persons.name: Anthony Aarons
persons.context: Editor responsible for the Bloomberg News article about Jean-Luc Brunel.

connections.description: Brunel is being investigated for the role he may have played in luring underage girls into Epstein's orbit.
Described as Epstein's former girlfriend and confidante, suspected of helping him lure underage girls.
Both are suspected of helping Epstein lure underage girls, according to the forwarded article.

events.title: Jean-Luc Brunel Detained in France
events.description: French modeling agent Jean-Luc Brunel was detained at Paris Charles de Gaulle airport as he was about to board a flight to Dakar. He was taken into custody for questioning as part of the French investigation into the Epstein case.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein killed himself in his Manhattan jail cell while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges.

events.title: Scheduled Trial of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody in New York awaiting a trial on sex-trafficking charges scheduled for July 12, 2021.

keyFacts: French modeling agent Jean-Luc Brunel was detained in France on December 16, 2020, as part of the country's investigation into the Jeffrey Epstein case.
Brunel faces French charges related to rape, sexual assault on minors, sexual harassment, and human trafficking of minors for sexual exploitation.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) declined to comment on the case or on whether an extradition request for Brunel would be unsealed.
The document confirms the ongoing, international nature of the Epstein investigation, with active probes in both the United States and France.
Ghislaine Maxwell was in U.S. custody at the time, awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges related to the same case.
